results.title: Phar Lap: the people's champion [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Eddie Carnana, Michael Dickinson, Rhett Kirkwood and Hall of Fame Corporation
results.brief_description: The People’s champion, Phar Lap, is an icon of Australia’s past. This video contains previously unseen footage of the greatest thoroughbred there ever was. Footage is contributed featuring Tommy Woodcock, Harry Telford and American businessman David Davis, as well as including the amazing story of Cups King Bart Cummings, whose record 10 Melbourne Cup triumphs is equally worthy of praise.

results.title: Phar Lap
results.brief_description: Phar Lap, a big, bold chestnut horse, reigned as king of the turf in the Depression-gripped Australia of the 1930’s. From humble beginnings the New Zealand bred horse raced on to become the hero of the nation. With fame comes envy, intrigue and danger. In the quiet streets of Caulfield on Derby Day 1930, an attempt was made to kill the champion. On Melbourne Cup Day, Phar Lap passed into history with yet another win. Phar Lap’s fame spread to the United States where he won the Agua Caliente Stakes - the world’s richest race - effortlessly, despite an injury. Success bred hatred. Sixteen days later Phar Lap was dead. Australia was in mourning. To this day his death remains a mystery, but the legend remains - the legend of Big Red.

results.title: Phantom of the paradise [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Edward Pressman, Harbour productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Director Brian De Palma offer’s up a colourful variation on The Phantom of the Opera in this outrageous Faustian parody of the 70’s rock scene. Paul Williams stars (and also acts as the films composer) as Swan an outlandish record producer who after hearing the latest composition from struggling composer Winslow Leach (William Finley), conspires to steal the piece for the opening of his latest nightclub, the Paradise. Leach catches on to Swans dastardly plan and breaks into Swans Death Records studio in order to destroy the pirated copies of his work. Unfortunately a horrible accident with the vinyl press leaves Leach grossly disfigured, thus transforming him into the Phantom of the Paradise. This masked spook then decides to exact his own brand of revenge, determined to ruin Swans latest glam rock show. Intitialy ignored and misunderstood on it’s first release, Phantom of the Paradise went on to aquire a loyal cult following, who laped up the skewered mix of horror, glam rock and music industry parody. Cast includes: Jessica Harper, George Memmoli, Gerritt Graham.

results.title: Phantom of the Opera
results.creator_credit: Jean Mathieson, Al Guest and Emerald City Productions
results.brief_description: In the eaves, the tunnels, the trap doors and the back stairs of the Paris Opera House a menacing figure watches. Captivated by the beautiful diva, Christine, the Phantom of the Opera is trapped by his hideous appearance hidden behind his cloak and mask. A beautifully animated adaptation of the ageless classic tale for children of all ages.

results.title: Phantom from 10,000 leagues
results.creator_credit: Dan Warner, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Curious title, considering the phantom rarely lurks deeper than six feet or so underwater. Kent Taylor and Rodney Bell are investigating several mysterious underwater deaths, supposedly caused by a sea “phantom.” The pair suspect that a professor of oceanography (Michael Whalen) knows something about the phantom, which he most certainly does. The phantom, a mutated sea monster, is the result of the professor’s evil experiments with an “atomic ray.” Both villain and phantom (which looks like an ulcerated beach toy) are dispatched by a few sticks of TNT. Famous for winning a ‘Golden Turkey’ award.

results.title: Phantom
results.brief_description: This video work is a mysterious, ghostly geography of cinematic shadows. Silhouettes that never quite take shape shift and glide across the screen, anaemic figures, seen in the negative, forced to wander between narratives restlessly but caught in a loop. These remnants from faint memories of filmic melodrama are a living dead confined to a space they cannot leave. They are the secret that lies between stories.

results.title: Phalaris staggers. Part 2: the acute stages
results.brief_description: Hyper excitability is invariably the symptom of the Phalaris Staggers in the acute phase. Generalised muscular tremors, rapid bobbing of the head, and lack of coordination in gait are also characteristic. This record of these outward symptoms was filmed at an experimental area at Brecon, in South Australia, between July and August, 1953.

results.title: Phalaris staggers. [Part 1: chronic phalaris staggers]
results.brief_description: Sheep grazing freshly shooting “Phalaris tuberosa” particularly following the break of dry season, often develop neurological disorders commonly known a “Phalaris Staggers”. The outward manifestations of the disease have been recorded in two films intended for veterinary officers. A complete lack of muscular coordination is obvious in all chronically affected sheep observed during an outbreak of the disease in the southeast of South Australia, in October 1951. Knees and fetlocks either remain flexed or tend to buckle under, and sheep move about with a propping gait on their knees. Exertion or agitation leads to respiratory distress.

results.title: Phalaris seed retention
results.brief_description:
In order to negate Phelaris crops from losing their ‘top’ before harvesting, crop-dusting is employed.

Features good footage of plane flying over crops and releasing chemicals.

Largely comprises of an interview between a presenter and a scientist.
